document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Career and Technical Education

EC152B5A957840CFA6D2BCD2C207D63C.description:
compare and contrast the relationship between inventory management and cost control in
food service operations.

CA55DCC93B0F4E10825EE3F14FF1E240.description: compare and contrast the concept of fixed costs, variable costs, and controllable costs;

F9BBDD16C2A2468F88290273A93B4C53.description: validate the effect of controlling costs on the success of a food service operation;

differentiate between the major costs in food service such as food, beverage, and labor
costs

7489303163144E129AA0B1A1E4E0E629.description:
The student analyzes the components of cost controls in a food service operation and develops a
plan to manage cost. The student is expected to:

justify the connection of flavor, texture, visual appeal, taste, and customer satisfaction on

6A30871AF9EF4B5EBD57CA25765E059D.description:
The student evaluates global cuisines, including the culture, history, and indigenous ingredients to

prepare for a state or national food sanitation certification or other appropriate

3D7D22AD1AD54C70AB34B46A545C18F2.description:
The student explains how employees, guests, and property are protected to minimize losses or

557679CE13D14ADFA23F29999B823EF6.description: create and update a career portfolio.

E7345B34A5134EBA9E554C42F179B1A1.description:
demonstrate major duties and qualifications for all staff and managerial positions to

E4DEE43DCAFA476298256DAF2BE8CEA0.description:
The student researches, analyzes, and designs a path to achieve career goals. The student examines

expected to:

5DC85EF59F50423EBA179428E276A388.description: demonstrate self-respect and respect for others;

AD3BAF673A1546B083D43CD949414D75.description: practice professional grooming and hygiene standards;

32F7BAD616FD4D478D4BC379E3E0E837.description: model effective oral and written communication;

CA16223E541F49B090F4FAC356A88158.description:
The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and
industry. The student is expected to:

F40CD018616548B3AF95E9B3E52EC276.description:
Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those
containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

5B8F1D274A9D4ABE8C93F791E2A5051B.description:
Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and
technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

8AAC732C93F54C1393195213C8FE532F.description:
Advanced Culinary Arts will extend content and enhance skills introduced in Culinary Arts by indepth instruction of industry-driven standards in order to prepare students for success in higher
education, certifications, and/or immediate employment.

24DCFD127FA84B53BA8259831C469595.description:
The Hospitality and Tourism Career Cluster focuses on the management, marketing, and
operations of restaurants and other food/beverage services, lodging, attractions, recreation events,
and travel-related services.

1D573B3017F1454C896FFBE3193731DC.description:
Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic
standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and
succeed in current or emerging professions.

26DE3F461A254E2F974D16F66CA58498.description:
General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 10-12. Prerequisite: Culinary
Arts. Students shall be awarded two credits for successful completion of this course.
